page.title: 08CHURCH HISTORY.
page.content: The church was re-opened in 1877.The Lychgate was erected in 1887 also a quarter chiming clock in the church tower. {THE OLD BELL.} This bell can be seen on the floor in the chancel of St. Michael's church.This ancient bell was saved when the other four bells were sold in 1850 to partly pay for the new chime in the new church.It was thought by the rector of the time <Rev.Severne> to have been given to the parish by the Rev.Blamyre who lived in Henry V111's time.Rev.Blamyre became Rector of Abberley in 1514.He brought the bell with him, probably from Cumberland.The bell when it hung in the old tower was cracked<probably by careless ringing in 1874>.The crack was so wide and long it couldn't be repaired,so it was taken down.
